topic: Spacing and Interleaving: Scheduling Study for Durable Mastery
target_audience: students and educators planning curricula and revision timetables

refs.content: Forgetting accelerates without review; repeated reviews shift the curve and extend retention intervals.
317 experiments: spaced practice beats massed practice; optimal gap increases with desired retention interval.
Synthesizes evidence on interleaving as a concept-learning strategy; aligns with Brunmair & Richter (2019).
Learners tend to underuse interleaving despite benefits; discusses metacognitive miscalibration.

special_instructions: Contrast spacing vs. cramming; illustrate interleaving with worked math/skill examples and when blocked practice is preferable. Provide ready-to-use spaced plan templates.
